meanings.definition: A short, sharp cry or bark.
meanings.sent1: The puppy let out a yelp when it saw its reflection.
meanings.sent2: I heard a yelp coming from the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent3: The yelp of the squirrel startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The yelp of the fire alarm pierced through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The yelp of the injured bird echoed in the forest.

meanings.definition: To utter a short, sharp cry or bark.
meanings.sent1: The dog will yelp if you step on its tail.
meanings.sent2: She tends to yelp when surprised.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally yelped when the cold water touched my feet.
meanings.sent4: The singer yelped the high note flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The child began to yelp with joy at the sight of the ice cream truck.

meanings.sent1: The yelp of the car brakes made me jump.
meanings.sent2: The yelp of the violin filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The yelp of the teapot signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent4: The yelp of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The yelp of the microphone feedback startled the audience.
